meanings.sent1: I need to regauge the temperature of the oven before baking the cake.
meanings.sent2: The mechanic had to regauge the tire pressure after fixing the puncture.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally set the timer wrong, so I had to regauge the time for the cookies to bake.
meanings.sent4: After the storm, the meteorologist had to regauge the wind speed for the upcoming forecast.
meanings.sent5: The tailor had to regauge the measurements for the dress to ensure a perfect fit.

meanings.definition: To measure or determine the capacity or contents of something again.
meanings.sent1: Before the experiment, the scientist had to regauge the chemicals for accuracy.
meanings.sent2: The engineer needed to regauge the fuel levels in the tank before the long journey.
meanings.sent3: The chef had to regauge the ingredients for the recipe after realizing a mistake.
meanings.sent4: The teacher had to regauge the students' understanding of the lesson with a pop quiz.
meanings.sent5: The carpenter had to regauge the length of the wood to ensure a precise cut.
